alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 28 at 3:26AM PDT until March 29 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Tree branches could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches below 6500 feet, with localized amounts of 12 to 18 inches above 8000 feet, are expected. * WHERE...The snow level will rise above 7000 feet in the afternoon, then fall to 5500 feet late tonight. The strongest winds will be near the ridge tops and along the desert slopes. * WHEN...1 PM today to 8 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for wet snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency and carry chains. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
